bIOQ7AOyi7BWGT_9buM0Zw.text: I don't like mussels.  They are too strong and too fishy! Don't care for the smell and don't care for them in soups or stews.  Until now I would have told you that I'd rather eat rattlesnake.  Appearantly in Scottland, there is an entirely different species of mussels.  We stopped in at the Mussel and Steak Bar for dinner before walking up to the castle for the 10:30 Tattoo.  Our travel mate ordered the mussel starter.  It arrived with green sauce on it.  OMG, it smelled amazing.  So much so that I had to taste it.  The little mussels were tender and steamed to perfection with a light pesto sauce driselled over them.  It is such a great combination!  I had the surf and turf for dinner.  The mussels were done in white wine and garlic and the ribeye steak was tender, juicey and cooked exactly as I ordered it. All four of us agreed that our meals were delightful.  The price was not out of line.  Service was spot on.

SpdjTAUq_AgsuP9ZuMi8bA.text: Was expecting a lot from this place based on the reviews, but honestly we didnt love it. It was just OK. Service was quick and friendly. They were also happy to oblige my dairy intolerance, which was nice. Both the seafood and steak were good quality, but I guess they were just a bit boring.   Boyfriend wasnt so keen on the strange warm, limp cabbage on the side of the steak. Although the steak was cooked as ordered (medium-rare) which was good. The queen scallop starter was OK, but the scallops were quite small and over-salted. Mussels were pretty good.   Overall a decent meal, but not good enough to get us over to Grassmarket on a regular basis.

qf1OFggESGUvG7CVocgLFQ.text: We ordered the big plate for 2 persons, which has a lot of mussels, clams, crab legs, prawns, and couple oysters.  It was steamed well in white cream sauce.  The seafood was cooked just right .  The service was very swift and good.  Highly recommended.

2pofOFx9JttlOFs4hUoT7A.text: An excellent experience - all of the food was of a high quality, as was the service..  Whether it was scallops, mussels, oysters or plaice, the seafood was first class and as fresh as the sea itself.  Steaks were also delicious, both ribeye and sirloin.  The wine choices worked well with the food and the choice of whiskies suited our need to try something different.   Staff were terrific. Attentive, friendly and showing real concern for our table.  We will be back.

9vxktIv4EGyORzzOUQgzOQ.text: the food is so bad here. We had the seabass and it's not fresh at all. The steak is dry and hard. The mussel is not fully cooked. The shrimp inside the mussel is frozen and dead for long time as the meat just melted.

mbTXVJxfZlgI5UAfEputjg.text: Great steak, great mussels, and great cocktails. Fun vibe in a great neighborhood. Get the chips fried in beef drippings.

QeHdHy8sGKqP5Gf29uzzTA.text: They offer chips cooked in dripping here, your reaction to this idea in some ways dictates your opinion of the Mussel and Steak Bar, personally I like it!  The menu is pretty much as focussed as the name, If you are not a fan of seafood or steak then this likely isn't the place for you, however if you are then the Mussel and Steak Bar will serve you some tasty examples of both. The lunch menu is a little basic and uses the cheaper rump steak cut, however the price is fair for this and the mussels got a big thumbs up.  In short the Mussel and Steak Bar is a good choice if you fancy some surf or turf (or both).

MeH2HfjJRBrt02AfVmqFKw.text: Whilst soaking up the festival atmosphere and trying to sift through the hundreds of flyers which had been thrust at us, my boyfriend and I came across the mussel and steak bar and could hardly believe our luck; mussels AND steak, could there BE a better combo?! We popped in for a spontaneous lunch and were seated immediately by polite and efficient staff. While I ordered a duck salad for starter and mussels for main, my boyfriend went for the three course lunch deal. The food did not disappoint, as all was beautifully presented, arrived promptly and tasted wonderful. Only downside was that my initial excitement at the designated gluten and dairy free menus faded when my starter was served containing Parmesan slices, despite the fact I ordered dairy free and had double checked when served that my starter was dairy free. I ended up leaving the cheese to the side, and when our plates were cleared the waitress realised the error and was very apologetic. The rest of the meal went smoothly and the manager gave us a huge discount, so no harm done as my reaction to dairy is not severe, but even so I'm giving the mussel and steak bar 3 stars instead of 4... But overall lovely atmosphere and fabulous food, will definitely return to try the steak!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sunshine and seafood, cant beat it!

Xmom6XVwZ9oZ8yhn1kQNag.text: We visited Mussel & Steak our first night in Edinburgh. We were only in Edinburgh for a week and had to come back again for our last night in town. Traveling is our passion and it allows to eat all over the world. The mussels here are the best we have ever had. Had langoustines the last night and they were just as spectacular. All the staff were very friendly.  One recommendation is to call ahead for reservations.

5gXLsbta81wMFknMKdDBwQ.text: On our last day in Edinburgh, I still hadn't tried Haggis.  And I really wanted to try it.  The waitresses we excited to watch me try it for the first time, they were chatty but not overly.  They were attentive, but not overly.  I had a good time, but next time I'd like to take my time and order more and stay longer.

t0f4p1JLscASG2LZD13MCA.text: Everybody in my family likes something different. My Dad likes Italian, my Mum French, myself Indian and my sister Chinese. The problems it causes when we each want our restaurant to provide something different. As a comprimise, we often decide that a restaurant serving British food is the best option - but then its time for the real battle to begin. Light and fresh sea food or good and hearty steaks?  It seems then that I should introduce them to Mussels and Steak Bar - which, as you would expect, serves Mussels and Steak.  Its no secret in the restaurant that the produce is local (or at least Scottish) and the ingenious menu combines seafood and heavy meats in brilliantly tasty ways. The sauces used are outstanding, if a bit 'out there' and incredably mouthwatering (In fact my mouth is watering as I type).  The restaurant itself is simple and practicle - and despite the annoying big screen TV's - has a seaside town feel to it,matching the down to earth cooking style. The staff are friendly and helpful, while the bar offers a large range of drinks.  So there you have it, a restaurant which can cater for all appitites and in a mouthwateringly excellent way.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussel and Steak Bar

JEItp5i4tGfFDbEU3NVssg.text: Mussels are so tasty! Impressive restaurant. Easy to access, warm service. Desserts and white wine are also impressive. Absolutely a wonderful choice coming back from the castle

thLQ6Qzpn_soLl0n02_z3w.text: Cute little restaurant with a great location on Edinburgh's grass market, with option to sit inside or outside. However, we were disappointed there was no salmon option for main lunch meal and the service was VERY slow. The food was lovely but the long wait on our meals prevents us awarding a rating any higher than 3. Also the staff weren't particularly friendly, not unfriendly just unenthusiastic.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pan fried sea bass fillets with pumpkin and Parmesan salad and sun dried tomato pesto
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

JRR8p1JcvrHTEpjUKy42vQ.text: Went for the 3 course lunch for 11.95, my first time at this place but recommended by a friend. Firstly I should add that I virtually don't eat fish, shellfish or steak. Uh-oh, not a good start with a name like the Mussel and Steak bar huh? I arrived at 1pm, downstairs was full, upstairs empty but rapidly filled up. The staff were nice and attentive. Food came in a timely manner...then it went sour.  Starter - Brie & asparagus tart. The cheese was warm enough to be highly greasy on a piece of soggy pastry hidden under some leaves of rocket. It was edible, but I think I've made better at home. If it had been baked a little longer I think it would have vastly improved. Main - wild mushroom ricotta ravioli. What was I thinking??? Still, if you don't eat seafood or steak that is the the veggie option. I never find ravioli to be particularly flavoursome and this dish was exactly that. The pasta itself seemed slightly undercooked and chewy rather than al-dente. The Parmesan on top had no taste and the tomato sauce was ok, but I think Lloyd Grossman does sauce just as nice for a lot cheaper.  Dessert - sticky toffee pudding. The pudding was ok, not the best I've had, but not the worst either. It's a light sponge with what I think were raisins and a separate sauce poured over. The sauce has a thin syrupy consistency, the kind poured from a large bottle from somewhere like makro or Costco - not like the kind baked with the pudding that turns gooey. A small ball of vanilla ice cream topped it off. All in all, I'd rate the food I ate as mediocre, I can't quite understand the rave reviews, but still what did I expect for 3 courses at that price? I also had 2 beers, West St Mungo, that were nice :)

eIMJjnIWODxMBCUR0HbdmA.text: Compared to the Outsider which has better steaks at the same price, this was disappointing. The steaks aren't nearly as good nor is the ambience. I had the smoked salmon app which was good but the steak quality was inferior to our next meal at the Outsider.

SbLUaQ3Keoh8rPEtlunfVQ.text: Cost-effective! Nice steak! Strongly Recommend courses. And the waitress is very nice. The smoked salmon is too salty. I can't handle it.

N2YP16zgWMdueJ_3e2vTJg.text: So you get mussels or you get steak.  We both got the steak.  It was our first day in Edinburgh and the restaurant was recommended by a friend.  Food was okay.  My steak wasn't all that flavorful and the chips were a tad bland as well.  Also, my food arrived to the table warm, not hot.  Y'all know how I feel about that.....  A little pricey but not really worth it.  Service was very good.

BjzrBlgGi80rtUes-KN_Sg.text: Loved the place. Great mussels and the service was amazing. You have to try the mussels. No idea about the steak though. But I would go for the mussels every time.

v6taWbXFF0a0r096qR3RNw.text: I ordered mussels with ginger/lime sauce and they were the best I have ever eaten. For 12.50, the portion was huge (may be 30 or more) and the sauce was more like soup at the bottom. It was spicy and delicious.

0ILZQo7Q7O7nSemUIZru6g.text: I had the Mussel plate for lunch. Don't remember being this satisfied with seafood. Good portion size too.

cit66E8KD2JpJOPFYfgeAg.text: Very good food and service.  Had the mussel pot - seems like the signature dish - with the garlic sauce.  Also had 3 prawns added in. They were very fresh and tasted good. Didn't go with 5 stars because as good as the mussels were, they were not unforgettably good. The accompanying chips and bread were very good.  Prices were reasonable and the service was attentive.  Particularly liked getting a big bottle of water so we did not have to bother the servers for refills.  It is a small place, so calling ahead for reservations is recommended.

gYeiI_21LzFWidjHbNkiyQ.text: I went here recently for a colleague's leaving lunch. There were 8 of us in our group & it was quite busy.   We ordered from the lunch menu - 1 course 7.95, 2 courses 9.95 or 3 courses 11.95.  Most of the group ordered starters & the haggis dish was the most popular.   I saved myself for the 6oz rump steak which was awesome. The chips were chunky & crispy, just how I like them & the mushrooms were earthy & full of flavour. My steak was perfectly cooked, moist & melt in the mouth.   A colleague had the seafood curry. It was full of enormous mussels & other fishy delights. It smelled amazing & he said it was the best fish curry he's had. The only problem being that it took so long to arrive he didn't have time to finish it before having to get back to work.  Unfortunately the service was slow and I we all had to skip dessert & coffee as we needed to get back to the office (despite being there over 90 mins).  A lovely lunch with great food & company. It was a shame the slow service meant it was a wee bit stressful. The front of house staff were lovely maybe they just need another pair of hands in the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mmm. Steak. Yum.
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bit cold to sit outside today

Cj_Cu6xvzKgbViE1Btat8A.text: Came for a late lunch and enjoyed great food, friendly service, and an overall excellent value. I recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Large scotch selection nicely organized according to taste attributes
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Confit duck and fois gras terrine

bGywW0VTky9YOW_n43AWxg.text: I've never written a review before, but after returning from my trip to Scotland, I haven't stopped telling my friends about this restaurant. 6 of us went to Mussels and Steak at the recommendation of a fellow traveler and we were blown away by the Seafood Sharing Platter!  When offered a choice of 1.8 kg of lobster or crayfish, we chose the lobster thinking that we would get more meat from the lobster. Boy, were we wrong!  Marshall the owner, showed us their crayfish, which unlike their American cousins, were humongous! Anyway, we had the lobster, along with a big amount of mussels, langoustine, prawns, scallops and oysters, all cooked to perfection.  We loved it so much, we went back a second time to try the crayfish. Also ran into another group of tourists who was there for their second night in a row, so we're not the only ones that were impressed.  Don't miss this gastronomic experience if you're ever in Edinburgh!

GKo16fylIKwPtGsaioNRHw.text: Disappointed. With a rating of 4 and half stars in Yelp lured us to the cosy corner of Victoria Street around our hotel when we are visiting Edinburgh.   One of the East European Looking waitresses was extremely rude when we asked if they still serve a Scallop dish (from a photo in Yelp page for this restaurant), she replied with a cold expression on her face and told us it's not on the menu, suggested us to read the menu carefully and walked away without even we could have replied or order anything from the menu. Later we were explained by another waiter some of the dishes are seasonal and the chef changes the special menu from time to time. The bizarreness of the rude and impatient behaviour by that waitress was lingering through the entire poorly prepared 2 courses  meal which we waited a long time to receive.  If it is cheap and rude, nothing helps. Any sensible people wouldn't go there again.

aRHLj-UuSU1aixUJvj8KYA.text: Been coming here after Scotland Wales rugby games, for many years now. Top tip is to book ahead as it always seems busy. The service is good, the menu has a lot of choice and the wine very reasonable.   The good is great. From pots of mussels, plates of cooked scallop and oyster served on ice for starters, through juicy well cooked steaks and chips cooked in dripping!! If you have space left the desert menu is also decent!  Well worth a visit if you are in town.

BBUGwYfheR4YJL_77_o55A.text: I must say the name of this restaurant is straight to the point and those two things are exactly what my friend and I ordered. The steak was alright, I've definitely had better, but I will say that the mussels were pretty damn good. Very flavorful and piping hot when they arrived at the table. They weren't as good as the ones I had in Belgium, but they definitely weren't bad, and there was also plenty to share for two people. The restaurant itself isn't all that fancy but their service is. They make sure you're taken care of throughout the entire meal.   Oh, you must get the Banoffee Pie. What's better than Banana + Toffee + Graham Cracker Crust. Absolutely nothing. It's heaven in your mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Banoffee Pie
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. 14oz Ribeye
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels with Garlic, Shallot, White wine cream sauce

S-5sTPnzhFksk4AY09P65Q.text: Popped in to meet a friend for lunch.  Looked very ordinary on the outside, but the food was top notch.   My husband had the best steak he's had this trip here.  Cooked perfectly and delicious!!  I had a seafood curry that was also fantastic. Friendly, helpful waitstaff.  Great experience.

EuItnAFcC7BvskhO4GEscg.text: Our meal was stupendous! Got the surf and turf. Ribeye steak was juicy and cooked perfectly. The mussels were cooked in a whisky, bacon and cream sauce. OMG! Unbelievably delectable. Portion sizes were enormous. Smoked salmon duo for appetizer was just as good as the main course. Overall one of the best meals we had in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ldoZRpriyacPFVkvtWqGGQ.text: Stopped for lunch and we weren't disappointed.   It was fantastic.  My wife had the mussel special and I had the hot seafood platter.  I watched them deliver a few of the Tomahawk specials and they looked incredible.  My only disappointment was that the hot seafood platter was mostly mussels and not very varied but still well done.   The outside look of this place does not represent the quality inside.  Service was great.

h0S3VvpTFURIKAecNyE5tQ.text: Very easy to find. Seafood place with reasonable price. We enjoyed both the mussel and steak :)

Lrnx8hRug4MYxGqd-YHBBg.text: This place has been a firm favourite of mine for about 18 months now. It's always been number one when I'm suggesting places to eat out to other people. The food is excellent and I love the location. The menu is fantastic and there's something for everyone.  With this in mind, I booked a table for myself and two friends who were visiting from England last night. Imagine my horror, when almost immediately, our waitress ruined the night. Her attitude was downright unpleasant; she spoke over my friend when taking drinks orders, then snapped at her to ''wait one moment'' before flouncing off with an air of one who has a gigantic chip on their shoulder.  I was more than a tad embarrassed that this is how visitors to our country were being spoken to in a supposed respectable establishment.  We concluded that she must have been having a bad day and, while still unhappy with her lack of professionalism, we were willing to just let it go and get on with enjoying our evening. We had our starters and as always the food was brilliant; but then Ms Attitude was back to clear our table, knocking another waitress away in the process she took away the bread we'd ordered. My friend asked her to bring it back and when she came to our table with it she said ''would you like three plates for your one piece of bread?'' In the most sarcastic and unnecessary tone I've ever heard (and I am the queen of sarcasm). At this point I asked the front of house to change our waitress because she was ruining our night and being downright rude.   Now, we all know that people in the service industry and any kind of customer service face a multitude of awfulness from the general public, which is why decent people will generally tip them when they've done a good job. However, this girl is asking for all the shitstorms the people of Edinburgh could possibly dream up when dining in this place, so much so that I've not even bothered to talk about the food in this review - that's how bad her service was. It completely overshadowed the food, wine and general atmosphere.   So at the end of the meal (after spending a lot of money in there) when we were paying the bill, we asked the front of house waitress if Ms Attitude was always so unpleasant to customers. She told us that this girl had thought my friend was someone who was rude to her in a club once. Bear in mind that my friends have been in Edinburgh a sum total of twice and have never been in any of the clubs in the city. Now if this is to be believed (which is pushing it for me) and she honestly thought my friend was someone who'd been abusive to her previously, why did she not arrange for someone else to wait our table?   I can't express how disappointed I am with how our meal panned out last night. I can say that I won't be back, despite the excellent food, I have no desire to pay to be treated like crap and then lied to about why, ever again.

Aqur97gqGmgSTP92QQ4W6w.text: We were in for the Edinburgh Festival and saw our favorite tapas place replaced by Mussels and Steak.   The atmosphere looked a little cold and modern but the menu was interesting.   In a word, the mussels were terrific! We tried the bacon and cream. Plump mussels, huge pot, delicious.  Our scallop starter was equally good. The steak was fine but next time we are just doing mussels. This is really their thing.  Not five stars as they just opened (second location) and fumbled a bit with forgetfulness and delays.  The staff and owner were very friendly and apologetic. Highly recommended  .

awZLb0WehCMFdM6bAv78Bw.text: The food was very good! It is indeed very mussel and steak which was what we were looking for. The service was good but I would not recommend it for a romantic dinner. Would definitely come back though...

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

UXYFVn5e_YoCU2mmxBglsQ.text: it's been a while since I've posted anything to yelp - but I noticed a distinct lack of available info during my travels to Scotland and Ireland, so here goes  This place is located at the (end of the) Grassmarket in Edinburgh - from what the guide books tell me, it would have had a great view of all the hangings (puir man got hangit) that took place there. The inside is modest but nice and aside from the somewhat crabbit (maybe German?) bartender, the service was just fine.  We split a bucket of mussels (shallot cream white wine sauce) and I had an 8oz ribeye - the husband had something weird like pasta.  The mussels were the best I've had in my life, truly amazing, and the steak, skinny little thing that it was, was delicious also.  The quality of the local beef and seafood spoke volumes - no extravagant preparations or sauces required.  Highly recommend.

rWXd5_rHVvuCubGsQTJUgQ.text: The mussel part was good and the steak part was bad. Great seafood and a great outdoor area with good service. However the steak offering was overstated. The ribeye on the surf and turf was very tough. And worse while my wife and I both ordered them cooked to medium they can back rare. I sent mine back and it came back a few minutes later still rare. Odd. Stick with the seafood.

CR7wHIhquzH3EV6e7IEj5Q.text: My favourite steak place in town! Great ribeye, even better sirloin and I just love being there at sunny days when you can enjoy your big fat fillet outside while lazily observing people come and go to Grassmarket.   The haggis is good, the wine is good and I have yet to try out the mussels for which I heard they are equally amazing. Keep an eye for the Sunday lunch deal where you can have 2 8oz steaks and a bottle of wine just for 30. On a single day the place is a bit pricey, but I am always more than happy to pay for good bloody piece of meat!

qcTJVZ5R_-Ef0_tKnPKneg.text: Fantastic location but very small on the inside, can be a long wait.  The seafood was only slightly above average in freshness and quality, and small portions, so had to knock off one star.

HMRA6uHM6qT3dfcndY_a4Q.text: I never fail to enjoy a good feed at the Mussel and Steak Bar. Pot of mussels with white wine and garlic sauce does the job perfectly. The ambience is pleasant, but it's better to sit downstairs as the upstairs bit feels a bit empty and lonely I think.   Food is generally lovely. Staff are generally lovely. Place is generally lovely. Go!

G7X-hJkpo-2RF7Zs2vGebQ.text: Great place. Food was delicious people were friendly. Recommend. Mussels cooked beautifully and the steak was juicy and tender. Young potatoes buttery and delicious.

L5YlBMaM4QnvF8xM_1Jg7A.text: The craving for seafood was strong with me on the day my husband and I came across this place....and they sure satisfied every bit of it.  We started with some delicious Bloody Mary's then moved on to a platter of fresh raw oysters (which we garnished with fresh lemon juice, hot sauce and even a little bit of red wine vinegar on some of them). After that, we got serious and dove into our buckets of muscles in a nice white wine, garlic and cream sauce. Perfection....every last one of them.  The service was great, the prices were reasonable and the food was phenomenal.  If you're in the area then you should definitely stop in for a bite.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. OYSTERS!!!! We could eat these for days!!!

fWlhfcYVRh3oygvuYII_lw.text: Right across the street from my hotel, the Apex, and couldn't have been more perfect. I gorged myself on a bucket of the Scottish Blue Mussels, cooked in a chilli, ginger, lime sauce. Delicious. washed it down with a local ale and absorbed the conversations in 5 languages around me. Lots of Asians eating here, lots of Eastern Europeans, lots of Spaniards. It must be good then, right?  Nice price, efficient service, great place. Recommended!

jdjKUVZUD5JC_6o2t4mGPw.text: Great restaurant that does exactly what the name suggests. We turned up early on a Saturday night after miss judging the walk time to the area it's in but they accommodated us without a question and we sat down straight way. The service was with a smile and really well organised, we felt welcomed and looked after.   The food was really good and turned up in good time, there were a couple of specials that had run out which was a shame but that's a sign of good food I guess.  For the prices paid I'd say this place is a great find and if I'm ever back this way again I'll be visiting for a second time.

17bT7TRCa5_BpPDBvoue9A.text: I'd recommend any seafood lover to go to the Mussels and Steaks Bar.  Excellent food, great service and located in a bustling part of town. The decor is basic but the great tasting fresh food and friendly service more then made up for it.    All the food was fresh, vibrant and flavorful.  Our group tried the seafood platter, the special lobster dish, curry mussels and the surf and turf combinations.  No one had a complaint about any of the dishes.  The best part was the double fried chips in drippings.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Roasted seafood platter
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lobster special

cofIGIcfFW6NPmiVw4pYYg.text: We found Mussel & Steak by chance and what a find! The seafood and the whole sea bass in particular were excellent and the service friendly and fun!

EiG75jvAUr8eMD2I_fgJ7w.text: This place was amazing! And the prices were great. The food was fresh and full of flavour with amazing presentation. It was so busy and the service was fast.  Will recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. King Scallop in Chorizo and garlic butter!

lpx51CmKp0qnKunRi0LI0Q.text: Absolutely #Loving this place is. Scottish Mussels w/garlic, shallots, cream wow! Pan fried cod w/ asparagus, languostinemushroom sauce on a bed of creamy mashed potatoes #ToDieFor #KidFriendly - so welcoming to kids even later night! Ps side salad so fresh and tasty lots of feta and the mushroom pate appetizer #FAbulous

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

68C-fF5QIyQuW2TNudoSrw.text: We got dinner here on our first night in Scotland and replenished our batteries before getting to know Edinburgh's nightlife. This is a nice Surf 'n Turf place with a cosy atmosphere and friendly staff where we enjoyed a decent steak and nice mussels. Finished it with a good dram (Jura and Auchentoshan, but plenty of other options).

lxNDA2vZqt7eZ0k1hg5hcg.text: I went here for the langoustines, and they did not disappoint.  They were nicely cooked and flavored with garlic butter.  The main course of mussels came with at least 30, and they were delicious as well (we had the chili seasoning). Others in our group had steaks that were nicely cooked (medium rare) and tasty--great chips, too. Our waiter was a bit casual with the service, but the other wait staff picked up the slack.  Overall, it was an excellent Edinburgh meal, with ingredients that featured the best that Scotland has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Langoustines!

d9kdJMmc_wOBh9Kv-9GK3g.text: Came here with family for dinner on a Saturday night. We booked in advance, but the place wasn't terribly busy in the end. The atmosphere is quite formal and a bit quiet, rather than bustling and busy. I went for the red curry mussels, as did my husband - my parents got the traditional with shallots and cream. The servers gave us the wrong mussel pots which took us a while to figure out, as all the sauce collected at the bottom and wasn't really coating the mussels, so we honestly couldn't tell whose was whose initially. We had to take some of the huge portion of mussels out and put them to the side, so we had space to use our spoons to coat the remaining mussels in sauce. Once we managed that though, the mussels were very tasty and fresh. The sauces were mild, but added a nice subtle flavour to the dish. Sides were decent but basic - slightly soggy fries, steamed seasonal vegetables, nothing terribly exciting. The price can't be beat though, at 14 for an enormous meal.  Not the most memorable of meals, but an enjoyable one. I think a loosening up of the atmosphere would go a long way.

lsCLzrqke3ZqLw1ZOEIqPQ.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant! Went two out of our three nights in Edinburgh. They have a wide selection of whiskeys at reasonable prices. The staff is friendly and helpful. My husband had the mussels both nights with different sauces and said they are the best he has had. I had the vegetarian pasta with mushrooms and truffle sauce - great! Tonight I ordered the seafood platter in a bouillabaisse sauce and it was delicious. A huge scallop, lots of shrimp, tons of muscles. Yum! The place is very busy so you might want to make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

K2NHGrPLPncaemIs43q-ng.text: The best surf and turf I have ever had.   I stumbled upon this place by accident during a day trip to Edinburgh. It was during Scotland's unexpected (and sorely missed) heatwave so we sat outside - a rare treat in our climate. We were the first diners when we sat down but by the time we left the place was full and there was a great vibe.   Now to the food. Me and my dad both opted for the same thing - the surf and turf. This consists of a Rib Eye Steak served with half a kilogram of mussels cooked in your choice of sauce, crevettes and squid rings. Being a big fan of Asian flavours I opted for the chilli, ginger and lime sauce. We also ordered some buttered new potatoes on the side to add some carbohydrate to all the protein.  When the dish arrived it was amazing. Perfectly cooked steak (medium-rare for me) sitting on a mountain of seafood - not many things could look so appealing. All the seafood was full of flavour, the sauce had just enough heat and the Corona with lime just added to an amazing meal.  Next time I'm in Edinburgh I will definitely be making a return here (I hope the heatwave will too).

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Surf and turf

rEh8U5U5bX0lRm49DdHQng.text: Had a solo birthday meal here in September. I know, bad planning but whatever. Walked in without a reservation, got seated upstairs. Had an excellent meal of raw oysters, mixed seafood platter, and a sticky pudding & the best shot of single malt I've had in a while!  It turned out to be a small batch produced, Talisker 5 yr. It was so good, I took the time to track the bottle down in a small shop (The Whiskey Shop on Victoria St) and bought 2 bottles to bring back home!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

fAX6RzUALYAp5mgN5VSAfQ.text: I went there for a casual lunch date with my SO. It is lovely. They have a pretty reasonable lunch and even dinner deal if you want to fine dine on a budget.   I had the steak and it was great! So good and nicely flavored and cooked just right. The mussels are great! They have a Thai inspired flavor which is not bad if you want something different.   I do recommend getting the French fries fries in beef jus. It's good and so much better than their plain potatoes.

Mgq0boVEdNBCYEb6VjkLRg.text: Why in the world would you name your restaurant the "Mussel and Steak Bar" if you are not allowed to sit and eat at the bar???

Ymuvr4CXsBLOtP0MeHorFg.text: Went here for dinner with my mom on a one night stay in Edinburgh. We shared the mussels in shallots and cream sauce and they were delicious. Very generous portion. Had to ask for bread to sop up the sauce.  For the main course I had the Roasted Seafood and my mother had the rump steak (can't remember the other name for it). Both were excellent. Steak was perfectly done and the seafood was fresh and plentiful. Definitely recommend it, just sorry this will likely be my only time there.

F75u7vq1dndChBrAX_eA2g.text: We had a light dinner here, it was fantastic! Fresh seafood at it's finest. Started out with Arran Smoked Salmon with Potato Scones, Creme Fraiche and Chives, the salmon was so fresh, it melted in your mouth. We also split a kg of the Scottish Mussels, we chose Shallots, White Wine, Garlic & Cream sauce, don't forget to order some bread to dip into the pot and soak up the goodness. This was probably one of the best mussels pots I've had.   Call and make a reservation if you can, we waited 45 minutes for a table (we went over to the Bow Bar to pass the time). If you can, sit outside, great people watching, right in the heart of Grassmarket.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Kg pot of mussels
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Arran Smoked Salmon

Vo3k73vxwCCX86vn7iMcMw.text: This is one of the first places in a long time that I don't have a quirky story or silly anecdote about... and you know what? That's ok. It makes total sense. If I could sum this spot up in one word, it would be:   Consistent.  It's consistently good food. Period. Granted, each time i've come here, I've stuck with wine, oysters and mussels - so I haven't strayed too far into the menu but really, I've never needed to. The mussels are delicious (I'm especially fond of the whisky/bacon combo).  The wine list is good. The service is pleasant. The prices are reasonable. The mussels are great.  Voila! Case closed.

lcyKTYsFF8311U4reDlDsQ.text: I went to The Mussel and Steak Bar after a date at the nearby BrewDog. The date was going well (oh la la) so he suggested stopping by this place for dinner. It was a Friday around 730 and we didn't have reservations, but we were able to be seated for a table for two. The manager was cheeky and ribbed my date a little bit for pretending to look in the reservation book to pretend to be someone else, which was very amusing. We were able to sit upstairs and I thought the place had lovely ambience.   We started with some fried goat cheese balls and garlic grilled mussels. Honestly, I'm not a huge fan of mussels but I thought "When in Rome!" and tried them. They were really tasty, but I'm not sure garlic was the best date choice! Anyway, for my main I had a special fried plaice with black pudding mash that was extremely tasty. My date had a steak that he enjoyed. Topped off with a nice glass of house white and I was a happy camper. I will definitely come back to The Mussel and Steak for another nice dinner in the future when I'm in the area, which of course I will be because I do love BrewDog...

7QjyLeAMWkCtdJxot5pwdA.text: Was our first trip to Scotland and Yelp pointed us to this place. Our experience was absolutely divine. Came in from the rain and they took our wet coats to hang an sat us down. Started with a craft beer and some haggis souffle! 1st time for that, and it wasn't too bad. For dinner my wife got the 14oz ribeye and we also go the seafood special for 2. Absolutely AMAZING!!!!!!! Gr8 service from the staff and our server Gary was perfect. Extremely satisfied with our time at this fine establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gr8 craft beer
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My wife&#39;s 14oz ribeye and the seafood smorgasbord

FZtOPyy--fk4-0jH5I9fFA.text: Make sure to make a reservation.  Our meals and  oysters were great. The house Pinot Grigio was also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

IrXL7zu6uo8hvkkQn7JuQw.text: This place absolutely does not like people from out of town or anyone when they are busy. It was raining, we thought we found the best place in Edinburgh for seafood and atmosphere. When we arrived the bar was empty, and there were empty tables. We were told 30 minute wait. We cant grab a drink at the bar. We were sent back out in the rain.  We went up the street to Onedine and they immediately took care of us. Stay away from The mussel and steak bar and support somewhere that cares about their customers.  I will never come back and never recommend this place to any of my friends or business associates.

SGL1DRpXEGbwidxjVlLhMw.text: Great seafood, the mussels were the best my husband and daughters had ever had! I had a salad with salmon - it was fantastic, but get the lemon dressing instead of the dressing that comes with it, it's divine.  We ended with sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice cream and the chocolate bomb with berries with lemon sorbet; a great ending to a brilliant dinner :)

P6TB0gW32-CzhanVi2ZZDg.text: Went here last night for a late dinner. Food is good but not great, I would say it's slightly overpriced. Service is great with super-friendly staff!

rm4U9Qpa6aUGTbmmuCqnQA.text: Great mussels and decent price. There are other mussel joints but this one is a great value and in a cool location. But the best is their sticky toffee pudding...hands down! Every time I'm in Edinburgh, I come here!

EbEWT1gAV1ja_yBr9Oo2VA.text: The sirloin steak was probably the worst I've ever tasted - this includes cafes in China! I asked for medium rare and what I had was more than well done, it was very hard to cut and bite and tasted very old - as if it was refrigerated for a week. I will never recommend this place to anyone, even you're very desperate and hungry, it's a disgraceful place and nothing worth the price.

oV7-UeO-Z5_Y9BdhFnpEiA.text: So friendly and yummy. Ordered the salmon - that was delicious! Salat was wonderful! The cheese cake is fantastic. Great vibe ! Will come back again!

I58pK8GBjlDJzpUbzIIF3A.text: Dinner here was well worth it. The service was exceptional. The food was very good. Before dinner I had 6 oysters that were very refreshing and clean and I had the surf and turf for dinner. The steak was cooked to perfection and the mussels were delicious. My wife had the chicken and it was ok but nothing special. I could easily eat here again.

azMGl3d34k7dj_Kb0TOuOw.text: This place did not disappoint. The oysters were really clean and tasty. The mussels were good. Only downside is when they get busy the service slows down. But the food overweigh me giving a 4.

_x8usns9xZm3LZKy84wu0g.text: Really good steak and mussels plus  amazing service. Strategically located in the old town. Will definitely be back on my next trip to Edinburgh.

iSPbb8zB7DgFSBQLvd6shQ.text: Amazing service and food set in a fantastic area! We loved everything about it! The mussels were the best we've had and the sticky toffee pudding was every bit as good as my own homemade version! Five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

jFd4mkh1EeT7cRqolV5jEw.text: This place was a good find as we walked from our hotel towards Edinburgh castle, decided to eat here .., we were not disappointed.  My friend had the seafood curry while I had pot of mussels with chips. The mussels were delicious and on par with mussel inn. I can no longer order mussels from cafe rouge as they are not the same ha ha.  It was quite busy as it was lunchtime and lot of tables of four or more people but we weren't squeezed into a corner but a nice table near the front area.   Recommend this place if you are this side of the castle!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels and chips
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seafood curry
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussel &amp; steak

9QqiMIcLUuXtXpY56hJxbQ.text: This was, by far, one of the best meals we've had while travelling through Scotland. We celebrated my parents 48th wedding Anniversary here and all 4 of us thoroughly enjoyed everything, start to finish. Parents had the Surf & Turf and the Seafood Linguini and both RAVED! about it. Staff was friendly and attentive but weren't rushing us. My wife had steak and I had Caesar salad with chicken and we also absolutely enjoyed it. Can't give a high enough recommendation for this wonderful find!

-Rx9IRHivs-B89qes6U5Fg.text: Best mussels ever. If we knew how tasty food (mussels in white wine and linguine with shellfish) they serve - we would have gone every night in our three days stay. Don't forget reservation if you want a table

dW3MIOh9a1_ACWhcexIUtA.text: Stumbled upon this gem. An easy wLk off the Royal mile and below the castle. The mussels were tasty and the scallops were terrific. The cost was reasonable and the service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Vpf1UOQqc9W7CMF-212Vnw.text: This place is ace!! The surf andturf with mussels and steak is a lot of food and so delicious. They substituted octopus for shrimp in my mussels, and it was tasty. Lovely attentive but not overbearing service and a reasonably priced wine list. We'll definitely be back bedtime we're in town.

ysNts1cdefwuYIL7tcHlow.text: Good service and very good food plus reasonable prices made this a real find.  It didn't look sleek or chic from the outside but had a better look inside.  We had mussels, venison carpaccio, salmon and filet and all had excellent flavor and presentation. A very pleasant surprise all around.

-kBwORytF9aJ2PPivv39Lw.text: Service was excellent!! The server was very attentive & accommodating. No one rushed or hurried us out even though we were the last to leave that night. Make reservations in advance if possible.  The Mussels were not bad although I had to order bread as it didn't come with bread. The scallops & bacon appetizer was a delicious combination. Yum! The Surf & Turf lobster tail & braised beef was my favorite entree and a big portion. The sirloin steak w/carrots & cauliflower was great. However, the mashed potatoes were not that flavorful.  Dessert - the chocolate mouse was good but the chocolate hazelnut (special of the day) was amazing! Must order this if you get the chance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pot of Mussels - make sure to order bread along with it.

rNQF1XakKBA05P81ixJwpg.text: Best fish and chips I've ever had. Muscles are also fantastic. Very reasonable prices as well. Highly recommend!

vYw5-sT8qmczeV1EdQpx8A.text: I cannot think of a single negative issue with the Mussel and Steak Bar. The food, the service, and the ambiance were all excellent. We had the good sense to make a dinner reservation in advance ( a wise thing to do anywhere in Scotland). My wife and I shared a bucket of Mussels, and I had the Seafood platter. It was all wonderful.

Dot-QvuY7Sd39K6UB4G7OA.text: Great food and service!! There were 9 of us in our party. We were served promptly and everything came out hot and delicious. Friend ordered their ribs and said it was the best she had. I ordered the Queens Scallops and haddock soup and apple and Gorgonzola salad- all were delicious!! Others ordered their seafood pasta and salmon dish - none of us were disappointed!!!

MVzCZWcuB9Y7bu5E5I_mBg.text: The short: NOT GOOD FOR KIDS.  TERRIBLE SERVICE.  FOOD IS GOOD, BUT NOT WORTH THE PRICE AND THE TERRIBLE SERVICE.  The long: My family, including my 8 year old son, chose to make a reservation at this restaurant based on the Yelp ratings and the fact that the Yelp reviews said it was Good for Kids.  I wanted to try fresh Scottish seafood being our last night in Edinburgh.  We arrived 20 minutes early for our reservation, and was told "we're not ready for you", which I understand.  However, after standing in the rain outside waiting until our reservation time, other walk-ins with no reservations were seated.  Around the time of our res, I told the same woman at the front "please let us know when our table is ready" and she looked at me with a quizzical look, and then said "yes come in".  When we were seated, my son knocked past our future waitress and she rolled her eyes.  We were seated literally in a back corner of the restaurant.  We were the only people with a kid there, and there were 2 other empty tables near ours (where we could have easily sat 20 minutes earlier).  There is nothing for kids to eat here.  Forget about it.  My son had the mac and cheese, which was made with sharp cheese, so you can imagine how that went.  The seafood stew was good, and the mussels were good.  The steak was thin and barely seasoned.  We could NOT get help from our waitress.  Our meal took an hour and a half mainly because I think we saw our waitress twice.  There were other large parties of adults there that looked like they were having a good time, but we couldn't get any help.  Twice we had to go to the bar to ask for water or bread or another drink.  When we got them, the drinks were quite good.  That's about all the positive I have to say.  With some management coaching, this place could be quite good.  Also, if they don't want kids there (as I was getting the impression), they should come in and correct this Yelp summary.  On a side note, the Barony pub had good pub food with great service.  Go there instead!

NBO0KdvjmcyCXLsjfB60Rw.text: What a great place to come in for some mussels on a cold day! The owners were very nice and service was prompt.  The one star deduction was because my boyfriend said the pork tenderloin he got with his "surf and turf- mussels and pork tenderloin," was dry. But the lunch specials were very reasonably priced. Just stick with what they are known for and you'll have an enjoyable experience.

xg5d0NEZopJm0p5Wqlft9A.text: First meal after landing in Edinburgh and couldn't stop thinking about it throughout the trip. I arrived somewhat early and was promptly seated at the window getting a great view of the outside while I ate. The server was very nice and friendly. I ordered the Cullen skink and a kilo of mussels with white wine cream sauce as well as an additional side of bread. the Cullen skink was like a seafood chowder and it was delicious. Then came the Potter muscles and that was pretty freaking good. That bread though... was out of this world. 2.25? Completely worth it. That bread was crispy on the outside and really soft on the inside and soaked up all that sauce from the mussel pot. The muscles were delicious and it felt like it was never ending. I can't wait to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Outside
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. View from the window counter
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cullen skink

OavgdcxTeYuOTf7MF4KYAg.text: We got three filets and two surf and turfs and a few salads to share. I wish for the prices that it would have been a bit nicer. The food was not prepared amazingly. I got a risotto that was bland and the dressings and sauces were like 3 stars. I imagined for a 30L steak it would have tasted like the cook cared. Not seasoned well, and the medium steaks were cooked nicely the medwell were way over. Best thing about the place is they are not shy with the cheese. But the salad had way too many things that didn't belong together. Watermelon was overkill.

jYfhHatheiO2ZaZPwGR0JA.text: Nice atmosphere.service was great.  I had the special soup of the day- sweet potato and ginger.  Omg this was so smooth and rich.  The flavors were out of this world.  There was chopped cilantro on top that added a freshness to cut the richness.  For my meal I had the salmon.  It was cooked perfectly with a great seared crust.  Tender on the inside.  So glad we stopped in for a meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

QqN_rm-7AGeHSm7VEqNnAg.text: This place is amazing!!! Give it a go when in Edinburgh and you won't regret! The service was on point, the manager was super awesome as well. The food is so delish!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish soup or Cullen Skink

HNFtSvQnh3CPO211GNaAEQ.text: We had a great meal with good service during peak hours. Started with the haggis Wellington, which was nice and crispy, definitely worth giving a try. The dry-aged Picanha was fantastic, perfectly medium-rare with a tasty whisky-creme sauce. If you end up with any sauce left over, pour it on the beef-fat fries. You wont regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Wellington
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Dry-aged Picanha, beef-fat fries, and a whisky-creme sauce.

66U5fFy0Byvb9V5N-m5dZQ.text: This place is amazing but don't try and walk in for dinner, you need a reservation. My boyfriend ordered steak and mussels, the mussels were in a whiskey and bacon sauce. Every fish dish that I saw come out was jaw dropping, thanks for the great dinner

RrQWYHdSArKbD40lpDx-Ew.text: We had a quick lunch at the Mussel and Steak bar. Besides that the air condition was dripping at our table from above it was ok. The waiters seemed to be tired from all the tourist that want to have a late lunch but tried to be friendly as good as it gets. My wife had the mussels, I had the steak. It was ... ok.

8tFWanB1FEa3GZh79JTMnQ.text: I am not sure why we were turned away, more like dismissed and then ignored, but we were not accommodated. I usually have a high tolerance for poor service.  But, ZERO SERVICE is not on my scale...hence this warning. 5 words, "Do you have a reservation?", then NOTHING.  He literally TURNED HIS BACK ON US!  We waited a few minutes for the cordial, "I'm sorry, we're booked."  But it never came. My party of 4 would not have entered the place if it were FULL.  We entered because we saw open tables and no line. This establishment is located in the Grass Market.  They have lots of competition.  So, without another word, we left. My travel companions and I are all travel industry employees.  We travel the world.  We will be spreading the NEGATIVE STAR RATING globally!

0tFxbbeGwrE62FnvhZc1XA.text: Had a great dinner here. We shared the cullen skink which was delicious, and then shared the mussels and steak meal which was great. Steak cooked exactly as we asked. The bottle of wine we had was very good. Highly recommend this place. Server recommended all of this down to the wine and did not disappoint

2xyHzx_V742ZTamt3A-Evg.text: Fantastic food highly recommend we're so impressed already planning to go back during this  4 day visit in Edinburgh. From drinks to the perfectly cooked 8oz filet and steamed mussels to the perfect sticky toffee pudding. Best meal so far in Edinburgh

2NcabUVDg18d46h6KXghfw.text: Very pricey menu but everything was so delicious so I would still recommend it. I got the Grilled West Coast Queen Scallops, with a garlic and herb butter sauce that I could probably bathe in - it was just that good. This was a starter dish and I was warned it was pretty small, so I also got chips and seasonal vegetables. I was thrilled that the seasonal veggies here in August were zucchini, broccolini, and mushrooms - not peas and carrots like everywhere else in the UK!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled West Coast Queen Scallops, chips, and seasonal vegetables

ZzOcA_oGdvUsMsmIpSwW_A.text: really good restaurant located in old town and amazing service,price is lovely. mussel is must ,clean and so delicious. my husband think that it is the best in this trip in UK.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1z_qzMd5IxCTYU2Hy8Hf_A.text: We had an epic meal here - just went 'all out' on the seafood platter.  Well worth it with a huge range of seafood and the most delicious langoustines I've ever had.  Wine list was a bit patchy in terms of getting something to go well with the seafood but that was a minor.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

jQesaUi5SAFeFwt749CDEg.text: A little bit overpriced. Seafood are generally fresh and tasty. The serving is slow. But overall, good experience!

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

qWX101eAEQpCjAJ40s4MQA.text: This is my favorite seafood restaurant. I found it in this app. All seafood are very fresh and delicious. The boss is so nice and warm-hearted. I will love to eat here again, If I come back in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ice cream
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sweet Shrimps
Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky Mussels pot

DgrPLxnT6DJyvhwLEJnrfg.text: This place is really good, but a little pricy I think. Although they do have some drink specials and a pot of mussels for about 13-15 pounds. But once you start ordering appetizers or any of the other entrees, it can get pretty pricey pretty fast. I didn't think the mussels were anything out of the ordinary really -- and I was surprised to find cilantro all over mine (usually it's parsley when you order a shallot, butter, and white wine sauce). This wasn't on the menu so I had to try and pick the cilantro out. The one must-order here though I would say is the grilled scallops with butter appetizer. It's juicy, buttery, slightly sweet scallops on the shell -- and probably my favorite thing here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Mussel and Steak Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Best thing here: grilled scallops appetizer

-D3HYiu9os6RdpDTOwVi4A.text: My best meal of the trip. It was our last night, and an unexpected find. The mussels are a must!  The sugar snap peas are exceptional. The chips (fries) are great with the mussels!  It was a perfect ending to our trip!  Do not pass up this hidden jewel!  Thank you Raphael!

Ce05X5kKcrIgp7O8NezCgA.text: I've never been a big fan of mussels, but this place changed my mind. So delicious! Great place to enjoy them with white wine in the afternoon.

U7wIblaF05QkXCKbGVIfOg.text: I come here. A lot. Either with my mum or with friends (usually to celebrate a birthday) this has become a personal favourite eating place.   Firstly, it does good food- whether you are into seafood or meat. You get to watch your food being cooked on a screen (which is slightly odd) and I love the layout of the ground floor- quite modern without over doing it. Look out for the fun facts about mussels in the toilets.  The service has always been super friendly at this place. Being in such a prime location I was expecting shocking prices but I was pleasantly surprised. They have amazing lunch deals and I have never walked out of this place hungry.  Sadly they only have one vegetarian option as far as mains courses go. Also, in the winter the upstairs floor tends to get really warm.   Aside of these hitches Mussels and Steak Bar is a good standard for me.

26Z04ZSvjBclBLxQ21WdAQ.text: The other reviews are  surprising. The first surprise is that a reviewer is surprised to find that Scotland, the north part of Great Britain (a well known island), has decent seafood. The second, and more disturbing, is the complaint that a restaurant with the name "Mussel and Steak Bar" has a fairly short menu. One might have thought, nay expected, that the menu would be mainly ...  On a positive note, what I can say is that they provide first class food. What they say they do they do well. The steaks, in my experience, are meltingly tender. The chips (US: french fries) cooked in beef dripping are crisp and moreish.  The restaurant is good value because not a  morsel will be left on the plates.

IDDdct0BOzNLRVsBRqZ2uA.text: I walked in on a Saturday.  Although the space was packed the staff found a cozy table for myself.  It only got better from here.  I was presented with a lunch menu and specials as well as the usual.  The staff were efficient and attentive.  The most important bit: the food was wonderful.  Smoked salmon appetizer, then 16 oz. of rump steak goodness cooked exactly as requested (medium).  The horseradish sauce was a nice touch too.  Again, props to the staff.  They handle a busy restaurant with grace and efficiency, even when one customer (me) discovers he's lost track of the time and is trying to square the bill and head out the door in a hurry.

V5RxjppLE-M_nFgIF2xFnw.text: One of the best spots for seafood in Edinburgh, and one of my favorite restaurants in the world.   Located just across the street from a longer strip of restaurants and pubs in the Grassmarket, it would be possible to pass the Mussels Steak Bar without giving it a second thought. That would be a huge mistake.  I've made about 12 trips here for lunch and dinner, and every time I've always been greeted by an unbelievably friendly waiter or waitress. They start you off with some of the best crusty bread and softest whipped butter you'll ever taste, and they are happy to replenish it many times over.  My favorite way to start a meal is with a kilo pot of their mussels, which are all ridiculously fresh and delicious, particularly with the white wine, shallots, garlic and cream sauce. Both the steaks and the seafood pasta (with loads of mussels, scallops, prawns, and calamari) are excellent main courses, and their fries with 'beef dripping' are some of the best I've ever tasted. Their wine list is not huge but offers good selection at reasonable prices.   The meal can definitely run on the pricey end depending on the conversion rate (if you're an American) but I have never walked out of this place unsatisfied. Highly, highly recommended!

NuYk_S3B3IafGekew3l-bQ.text: To my surprise, Scotland is rich with seafood cuisine.  Prior to my vacation there, I imagined Scottish cuisine to be rich with beef (highland cows!) and haggis.  But it's easy to find mouth-watering seafood everywhere!  Order the surf and turf w/creamy shallot white wine.  The bread pairs nicely with the juice of the mussels and white wine.  The chili, ginger and coriander sauce is tasty, but honestly, it is NOT as delectable as the white wine.  The beef is truly juicy, but make sure you specify if you want it cooked medium, rare, well-done, etc.  The seasoning if fairly simple, but it works!  The staff is friendly, and there's a tv that shows what the chefs are cooking.  I'm not quite sure if it's real-time or if all of it is pre-recorded, but it's kinda neat to see what meals are about to be served.

IrchMqHAL3mZbp02GeDThg.text: Wow. This place was Sooooo good.  Oysters rib eye and cheesecake were all incredible. The side of mushrooms were also very good. The prices are great for what you get.

woF0CafkQdtZDt_9HaCdXQ.text: We always eat here on our annual family visit to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. It is centrally located being a 3-4 minute walk from the Fringe Hub.  The mussels are fresh and cooked perfectly, no rubbery over done ones and non under cooked. The mussels are cooked in four sauces, my favourite is the Thai, though all are good. Great chips too. Veg have to be ordered separate i.e. on top of the price as far as I remember.  They do a great lunch deal, the portions are smaller but at approx 60% of the evening price well worthy it. During the month of Aug it does get busy and you may have to wait for a seat. We get round this by eating early or late and fitting our meals around the shows.

OdOpcx8KHgp9yAJX4zfdOg.text: My favourite place for a mussel pot in Scotland. As an added bonus they also serve some of the best chips I've ever enjoyed - just make sure to get the ones cooked in roast beef drippings!

_Ki-H1WGwEGVc6K8c6zmGQ.text: I really liked this place and ate here twice during the Edinburgh Comedy Festival. They have absolutely amazing mussels. Go for the kilo not the smaller portion or you'll regret it (and have to order more). If it's sunny, I highly recommend you sit outside. This place is very central, the service is great, the food was amazing... I will be back!

Zbzh9ihIEPJCX0QgEjyDag.text: Wonderful steak, wonderful mussels, great value!   A great place for meat and fish lovers like me - I highly recommend.   Ess

Ge9Wlol838Stdhm5kQUfJQ.text: So we're sitting in the hotel bar on Grassmere in Edinburgh and ask the bartender for a restaurant recommendation.  She says "Mussels" and tells us it's nearby.  I glibly comment that maybe there's a review of it in my iPhone YELP app, and lo and behold there is!  Sold.  I don't particularly like mussels (the shellfish) nor curry, but I boldly decide to order the Seafood Coconut Curry, which consists of mussels, squid, king scallops, and prawns.  When it arrives, it is 75% mussels, so I'm apprehensive; but it was outstanding!  (Those mussel shells take up a lot of space.)  All four of us loved our meals, and we highly recommend this restaurant.

Wm4TI3EnVaC35DQyZ2WBnQ.text: Very tasty food, great beer and really friendly service!!

iZC379_rhDxb4fs-a4XBSg.text: Mouth is watering at the thought, this was the best meal I have had in a very long time, staff were pleasant enough. Muscles were huge, so tasty and very well cooked, the basket of bread was replaced a few times. Will be back soon :)

weCHYpUdlfg3aM_PXGwAmw.text: Two words: amazing mussels. I have had many a moule frites in my life, but this place probably ranks in the top three for me. The mussels are plump and juicy and the broth is perfectly made -- full of flavour but not overwhelming the taste of the mussels. I was sopping it up with bread the whole way through. I tried the steak as well, but it wasn't anything particularly outstanding for me.   Fair warning though, if you're tempted by both the steak and the seafood option, don't go for the surf and turf! The quality of the seafood in the surf and turf is not as good as individual orders of seafood for some reason, so I'd highly suggest just sharing two mains with your dinner partner and getting the best of both worlds.

VTylazw9aG4M7IQbGMzz_g.text: Fantastic seafood, with a wide menu selection. Staff are friendly, eager to please and not afraid to make an honest recommendation or suggestion. The restaurant is generally busy, mostly down to it's great reputation and location. The prices are reasonable given the quality and quantity. Also great at dealing with larger groups of dinners so a good place to book a special family meal

aXaFqEQ05gRqZYa9CSxxmQ.text: The Mussel and Steak Bar is THE place to go if you love your seafood. The food is excellent and the service is equally good. I wasnt keen on squid before I visited here, but after ordering the seafood platter Ive changed my opinion, cooked to perfection, not a hint of rubber about it and very good value for money too. The wine list is also excellent, your in for a real treat if you visit, I will definitely be back, no doubt about it! Yummy!!!

jaH1ZzTCgPAUZ5ktpcNBfA.text: AMAZING! Went at tea time on Monday night and couldnt have left fuller or happier :) Waiting staff are very very attentive and friendly. I had smoked salmon salad for starters and mussels in white wine and garlic for main and it was superb. It is a wee bit more expensive than other places but I would say its definately worth it. Food served very fast as well.

cqDIsJfwh50sTSyW6ZBxJQ.text: This is a gem in an otherwise touristy Grassmarket. This place has fantastic food, Oysters, Fish, Steak, and plenty of other options. But the specialty has to be the mussels. Choose a mussel pot and have it in any of five ways to suit your palate and mood, just take your pick. Depending on how hungry you are choose a full three course, or share a divine starter and dessert. All this with great service, good price and fresh atmosphere.

0ldyPXbQkOgMsq-M7IlZjg.text: had the lunchtime menu. loads of bread on tap,very attentive waiters. 9 bottle of wine was very nice. steak was melt in the mouth and mussels were fab. have your chips in beef dripping. cheeseboard excellent,lovely quince jam. well worth a visit. polish waiter was very friendly and professional we will def return
